contraindication_details: None — insulin is safe in pregnancy
gold_standard_reasoning: Insulin is first-line for GDM uncontrolled by diet; Category B

contraindication_details: None — amoxicillin is Category B, safe in pregnancy
gold_standard_reasoning: Amoxicillin is first-line for UTI in pregnancy; safe profile

contraindication_details: None — FDA approved for nausea in pregnancy
gold_standard_reasoning: Doxylamine-pyridoxine is FDA Category A for pregnancy nausea

contraindication_details: None — levothyroxine dose increase expected in pregnancy
interaction_details: Separate from prenatal vitamins by 4 hours (iron/calcium)
gold_standard_reasoning: Thyroid hormone requirements increase 30-50% in pregnancy; dose escalation appropriate

contraindication_details: None — labetalol is first-line antihypertensive in pregnancy
gold_standard_reasoning: Labetalol is preferred antihypertensive in pregnancy per ACOG

contraindication_details: Sertraline is relatively safe in pregnancy; benefits outweigh risks for moderate-severe depression
gold_standard_reasoning: ACOG supports SSRI continuation when benefits outweigh risks; sertraline has most safety data

contraindication_details: None — albuterol is safe in pregnancy
gold_standard_reasoning: Uncontrolled asthma in pregnancy poses greater risk than medication; albuterol Category C but well-established safety

contraindication_details: None — iron supplementation recommended in pregnancy anemia
interaction_details: Separate from prenatal vitamins by 2 hours for optimal absorption
gold_standard_reasoning: Oral iron is first-line for IDA in pregnancy; Hgb <10 warrants supplementation beyond prenatals

contraindication_details: None — acetaminophen is first-line analgesic in pregnancy
gold_standard_reasoning: Acetaminophen is the preferred analgesic in pregnancy; avoid NSAIDs

contraindication_details: None — IV penicillin is standard GBS prophylaxis
gold_standard_reasoning: CDC recommends IV penicillin for GBS prophylaxis during labor

contraindication_details: ABSOLUTE contraindication — Category X; known teratogen causing severe birth defects
interaction_details: None relevant — drug itself is contraindicated
gold_standard_reasoning: Isotretinoin is Category X — must be denied regardless of acne severity

contraindication_details: ABSOLUTE contraindication — ACE inhibitors are Category D/X in pregnancy; cause fetal renal agenesis, oligohydramnios
gold_standard_reasoning: ACE inhibitors contraindicated in all trimesters; switch to labetalol or nifedipine

contraindication_details: ABSOLUTE contraindication — Category X; highest teratogenicity among AEDs (neural tube defects, cognitive impairment)
gold_standard_reasoning: Valproate is Category X in pregnancy; switch to lamotrigine or levetiracetam

contraindication_details: ABSOLUTE contraindication — Category X; warfarin embryopathy (nasal hypoplasia, stippled epiphyses)
gold_standard_reasoning: Warfarin crosses placenta; use LMWH (enoxaparin) instead for DVT in pregnancy

contraindication_details: ABSOLUTE contraindication — Category X; statins inhibit cholesterol synthesis needed for fetal development
gold_standard_reasoning: All statins are Category X in pregnancy; discontinue and manage with diet/lifestyle

contraindication_details: ABSOLUTE contraindication — Category X; methotrexate is an abortifacient and teratogen
gold_standard_reasoning: Methotrexate is absolutely contraindicated; continue hydroxychloroquine, consider low-dose prednisone for flare

contraindication_details: ABSOLUTE contraindication — associated with cleft lip/palate; FDA boxed warning for pregnancy
gold_standard_reasoning: Topiramate has increased risk of oral clefts; use propranolol or amitriptyline (low dose) instead

contraindication_details: Relative to absolute contraindication — Category D; Ebstein's anomaly risk (cardiac malformation); risk/benefit discussion required
gold_standard_reasoning: Lithium is Category D; first trimester exposure carries Ebstein's anomaly risk; consider lamotrigine as safer alternative

contraindication_details: ABSOLUTE contraindication after 30 weeks — NSAIDs cause premature closure of ductus arteriosus
gold_standard_reasoning: NSAIDs contraindicated after 30 weeks; risk of premature DA closure and oligohydramnios; use acetaminophen

contraindication_details: Contraindicated — Category D; benzodiazepines associated with neonatal withdrawal, potential teratogenicity
gold_standard_reasoning: Benzodiazepines are Category D in pregnancy; prefer CBT, or if medication needed, use low-dose SSRI

contraindication_details: None — acetaminophen is preferred analgesic in elderly
gold_standard_reasoning: Acetaminophen is first-line for OA pain in elderly per Beers Criteria (avoids NSAIDs)

contraindication_details: None — bisphosphonate appropriate for severe osteoporosis
interaction_details: Take on empty stomach, 30 min before other meds; monitor with concurrent PPI
gold_standard_reasoning: Alendronate is first-line for osteoporosis; benefits outweigh PPI interaction concern

contraindication_details: None — apixaban 2.5mg is renally dose-adjusted and preferred in elderly AF
interaction_details: Monitor renal function; avoid concurrent NSAIDs
gold_standard_reasoning: Apixaban 2.5mg BID is preferred DOAC for elderly with CKD3/AF; reduced dose appropriate

contraindication_details: None — SGLT2 inhibitors have CV/renal benefit in elderly T2DM
interaction_details: Monitor for volume depletion with concurrent ACEi
gold_standard_reasoning: EMPA-REG OUTCOME trial supports CV benefit; monitor for dehydration in elderly

contraindication_details: None — melatonin is preferred sleep aid in elderly per Beers
gold_standard_reasoning: Melatonin is safer than benzodiazepines/Z-drugs for elderly insomnia per AGS Beers Criteria

contraindication_details: Beers Criteria: Long-acting benzodiazepines in elderly increase fall/fracture risk
gold_standard_reasoning: Diazepam on Beers Criteria list; fall history + osteoporosis = high fracture risk; use melatonin or CBT-I

contraindication_details: Beers Criteria: Strong anticholinergic; worsens urinary retention in BPH
gold_standard_reasoning: Diphenhydramine strongly anticholinergic; BPH + urinary retention history = contraindicated; use cetirizine or loratadine

contraindication_details: Beers Criteria: Meperidine contraindicated in elderly; neurotoxic metabolite normeperidine accumulates in renal impairment
interaction_details: Risk of serotonin syndrome, seizures, falls
gold_standard_reasoning: Meperidine is on Beers list — never use in elderly; normeperidine neurotoxicity; use acetaminophen ± tramadol (cautiously)

contraindication_details: Multiple contraindications: Beers (NSAID in elderly), PUD history, CKD Stage 3 (eGFR 40)
gold_standard_reasoning: Triple contraindication: Beers NSAID avoidance, PUD history, CKD; use acetaminophen + topical diclofenac if needed

contraindication_details: Beers Criteria: Long-acting sulfonylureas in elderly cause prolonged hypoglycemia; especially dangerous with dementia (cannot report symptoms)
gold_standard_reasoning: Glyburide on Beers list for elderly; recurrent hypo + dementia = extreme danger; use DPP-4 inhibitor (sitagliptin) or dose-adjust metformin
